Requirements: A minor in accounting is available to all undergraduate students except those majoring in accounting. A minimum grade of C is required in all courses for the minor.
Description: The accounting minor provides students with the foundational knowledge of accounting required to understand and interpret financial information. Students will gain an understanding of financial reporting, managerial accounting and auditing. This minor can complement a variety of majors in the School of Business and across the University.

EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. Quinnipiac accepts the following: TOEFL score of 85 or higher on the iBT, IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, Duolingo English Test score of 110 or higher, Pearson PTE score of 56 or higher, or successful completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements: To apply for admission to an undergraduate program, a prospective student must submit the following: Completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor; Personal essay or writing sample.
Description: Accounting is the language of business. The Bachelor of Science in Accounting degree program prepares students for professional careers in public accounting, corporate accounting, governmental accounting, and not-for-profit accounting. Accounting is one of the most in-demand business fields, and Quinnipiac’s BS in Accounting program positions graduates to succeed in the field. Students learn skills in financial accounting, managerial accounting, auditing, taxation, and accounting information systems. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills and prepares students for a career as a professional accountant and for the CPA exam. Our curriculum combines a strong foundation in accounting principles with an understanding of the broader business environment, including ethical considerations, global perspectives, and technological advancements. Students gain practical experience through internships, case studies, and real-world projects, enabling them to apply classroom knowledge to real-world scenarios. We prepare our students to become business leaders by providing them with the expertise to interpret and utilize financial information, make informed decisions, and contribute to the success of any organization.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Advertising and Integrated Communications
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English language proficiency. Quinnipiac University requires a minimum score on one of the following exams: TOEFL iBT: 85, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo English Test: 115, PTE Academic: 56.

Quinnipiac accepts the Common Application exclusively. First-year applicants will need to submit:

- The Common Application
- Official high school transcript(s)
- One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor
- Personal essay
- Test scores (optional for most programs)
Description: The Advertising and Integrated Communications, BA, program provides students with the critical understanding, skills, and strategic perspective needed for careers in advertising, branding, public relations, and other related integrated communications fields. Advertising, public relations, social media, and other marketing communications are increasingly integrated, and this program recognizes this trend by preparing students to work within a variety of agency, corporate, and nonprofit settings. Students are exposed to critical perspectives in media studies as well as professional best practices. Students create portfolios of their work and graduate prepared to work for clients from across a variety of industries.

ProgramName: Minor in Advertising and Public Relations
Description: The Advertising and Public Relations minor exposes students to key theories and practices in the creation, execution, and evaluation of communication campaigns. Students learn to research, strategize, and write for a variety of media while considering ethical concerns. They engage in the study of advertising and public relations within a broad liberal arts context, examining the impact of these fields on culture and society. Students gain foundational knowledge and skills for pursuing careers in advertising, public relations, social media, and related fields.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based and need-based scholarships and grants

Requirements: To be admitted to the minor in aging studies, students must have a GPA of at least 2.500 and must obtain the signature of the program director.
Description: The Aging Studies minor provides students with the foundational knowledge and interdisciplinary skills to work with and advocate for older adults across varied settings. Students will explore the physical, psychological, social and cultural aspects of aging. The minor is a valuable complement to students pursuing degrees in a wide range of fields including, but not limited to, health sciences, nursing, physical therapy, occupational therapy, social work, psychology, sociology, political science, education, business, communications and law. The minor consists of 18 credits.

EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their first language and who have not studied in an English-speaking school for the last three years are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Quinnipiac accepts the following tests and minimum scores: TOEFL iBT: minimum score of 85; IELTS: minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test (DET): minimum score of 115; Pearson Test of English (PTE): minimum score of 56.
Description: The anthropology minor introduces students to the holistic study of humanity and human behavior across time and space. Anthropology uses a variety of methods and theories from the social and natural sciences and the humanities to study the human condition. Students will learn how to critically analyze and understand human societies and cultures and the biological and evolutionary basis of human behavior, using both quantitative and qualitative methods.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Applied Business
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate a command of the English language. Quinnipiac University accepts the following to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Duolingo English Test (DET), PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English). A minimum TOEFL score of 85 on the IBT, a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 115, or a minimum PTE Academic score of 56 is required. The English proficiency requirement may be waived for students who have attended a U.S. high school for at least three years, or attended a high school where the primary language of instruction was English.
Requirements: Complete our free online application. Request that official transcripts from all colleges and universities you have previously attended be sent directly to Quinnipiac University. You may choose to submit a personal statement outlining your educational and professional goals. You may choose to submit a resume highlighting your professional experience.
Description:
The mission of the Bachelor of Science in Applied Business program is to provide students with a solid foundation in core business concepts and essential skills that are directly applicable to various professional settings. This program is designed for students who seek a comprehensive understanding of business operations, management, and strategy, emphasizing practical application and real-world problem-solving.
Upon successful completion of the Bachelor of Science in Applied Business program, students will be able to:
1.  Demonstrate a fundamental understanding of core business disciplines, including accounting, finance, marketing, management, and economics.
2.  Analyze business problems and opportunities using critical thinking and analytical skills.
3.  Formulate effective business strategies and make informed decisions based on relevant data and ethical considerations.
4.  Communicate effectively in diverse business contexts, both orally and in writing.
5.  Collaborate effectively in team settings to achieve common business goals.
6.  Apply business principles and practices to address real-world challenges and adapt to dynamic business environments.

ProgramName: Minor in Applied Statistics and Data Science
Requirements: A student may minor in applied statistics and data science by completing the following 18 credits with a grade of C or better in each course. A maximum of two courses in the minor may be used to satisfy a major or another minor requirement. A minimum of three of the courses in the minor must be taken at Quinnipiac University.
Description: The Minor in Applied Statistics and Data Science provides students with an introduction to the interdisciplinary field of data science, preparing them for careers in data analytics. Students will develop essential skills in data collection, visualization, analysis, interpretation and communication using cutting-edge statistical software.

The Minor in Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides students with an understanding of AI theory and practice across various applications, including machine learning, computer vision, natural language processing, and robotics. The minor is a multidisciplinary program open to all students across the university. The minor will allow students to:
* Develop an understanding of the fundamental theories and concepts of AI.
* Explore the principles and methods of machine learning, deep learning, and data mining.
* Gain hands-on experience in building, training, and evaluating AI models.
* Apply AI techniques to solve real-world problems in various domains.
* Analyze the ethical implications and societal impact of AI technologies.
* Prepare for careers in AI-related fields or further graduate studies.

The interdisciplinary minor in Asian Studies is designed to provide students with a general knowledge of the history, societies, cultures, economies, and political systems of Asia. This minor is intended to supplement the student’s major field of study, providing a global perspective. The minor provides students with knowledge about a region that is critically important in the 21st century. Through an interdisciplinary approach, students gain a better understanding of the diversity and complexity of Asia.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Athletic Training
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency. An official PTE score of 56 or higher. An official Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 115 or higher. Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Behavioral Neuroscience
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit official results from one of the following English language proficiency exams: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo English Test (DET), or Pearson Test of English (PTE). The English language proficiency requirement may be waived for applicants who have attended a secondary school/high school in the United States for 3 or more years and have earned passing grades in all English (not ESL) courses.
Requirements: A complete first-year application includes the following: Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, including your essay/personal statement; Official high school transcript(s); Secondary school report form and counselor recommendation; One letter of recommendation from an academic teacher; $65 nonrefundable application fee, or a fee waiver. Standardized test scores are optional for most programs; if you choose to submit them, you may self-report your scores on your application. Official scores will be required for students who enroll.
Description: Behavioral Neuroscience majors explore the biological basis of behavior and cognition in humans and animals. This interdisciplinary field integrates concepts from biology, psychology, neuroscience, and pharmacology, offering a comprehensive understanding of how the brain influences behavior and vice versa. Our program emphasizes hands-on learning, research opportunities, and practical applications, preparing students for careers in research, healthcare, and advanced graduate studies.

EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT with a minimum score of 85, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 115, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 56. The English proficiency test may be waived if you have studied for 2 or more years in a high school where English is the language of instruction or if you are from an English-speaking country.
Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit the following: The Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; an official high school transcript; and one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor. Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT) are optional for the Bachelor of Science in Biochemistry program.
Description: Biochemistry is the study of life at the molecular level and is a bridge between the biological sciences and chemistry. Our graduates are prepared for careers in research, biotechnology, medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, forensic science, toxicology, and other health sciences. Many graduates continue their studies in graduate school or professional school programs. The interdisciplinary nature of biochemistry integrates elements of chemistry, biology, molecular biology, genetics, and cell biology. Students will learn the molecular mechanisms underlying biochemical processes central to all forms of life and apply biochemistry principles to real-world issues in biotechnology, medicine, and pharmaceutical sciences. Our degree offers a traditional curriculum designed to prepare students for successful careers in biochemistry and for further studies in graduate or professional school. Students gain hands-on experience by working with state-of-the-art instrumentation including Fourier-transform infrared (FTIR) and ultraviolet-visible (UV-Vis) spectroscopy, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy, mass spectrometry (MS), atomic absorption (AA) spectroscopy, chromatography, and protein electrophoresis.

EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, demonstration of a satisfactory level of proficiency in the English language is required. Requirements: To apply to Quinnipiac as a first-year student, you’ll need to submit: The Common Application, Your official high school transcript, 1 letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor, A personal essay.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Marketing
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. Quinnipiac accepts a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 85, a minimum IELTS overall score of 6.5, a minimum PTE Academic score of 56, or a minimum Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 115.
Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit: The Common Application, official high school transcript(s), two letters of recommendation (one of which must be from your school counselor), and an essay (Personal Statement).
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Marketing is designed to address the increasing demand for professionals with expertise in both marketing and the biomedical field. This interdisciplinary program prepares students for careers in the dynamic and rapidly evolving healthcare and biotechnology industries. Students will gain a strong foundation in marketing principles, business strategies, and an in-depth understanding of biomedical science, ethical considerations, and regulatory environments unique to the biomedical sector. The curriculum integrates core marketing concepts with specialized knowledge in areas such as pharmaceutical marketing, medical device sales, healthcare analytics, and biotechnology commercialization. Graduates will be equipped to develop and implement effective marketing strategies for biomedical products and services, bridging the gap between scientific innovation and market needs.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Sciences
EnglishScore: If English is not your first language, you will be required to demonstrate your English proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the TOEFL (minimum score of 85 iBT), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 110), Pearson PTE Academic (minimum score of 56), or successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements: A completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; Official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor; List of senior year courses; SAT/ACT Scores (optional, see our test-optional policy).
Description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Biomedical Sciences program provides a broad-based education in the biomedical sciences, with a strong emphasis on foundational science and critical thinking skills. This program is designed to prepare students for careers in research, healthcare, and biotechnology, as well as for further graduate or professional studies. Students will develop a deep understanding of human biology, disease mechanisms, and therapeutic interventions, gaining hands-on experience through laboratory coursework and research opportunities.

Requirements: Students must have completed BIO 101 and BIO 102 (or the equivalent), both with a minimum grade of C, prior to declaring a minor in biomedical sciences.
Description: The Biomedical Sciences Minor provides a pathway for students pursuing careers in healthcare who are interested in enhancing their science background and developing a deep understanding of human health and disease. Students complete coursework that provides a foundation in human anatomy and physiology, cell biology, genetics, immunology and pathophysiology. This minor complements a number of majors including biochemistry, biology, health science, microbiology and molecular genetics, nursing, physical therapy, and physician assistant.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Business Analytics
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by providing the results of one of the following tests: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) - A minimum score of 85 is required on the internet-based test (iBT), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - A minimum overall band score of 6.5 is required, Pearson Test of English (PTE) - A minimum score of 56 is required, Duolingo English Test - A minimum score of 115 is required, ELS Language Center - Successful completion of level 112 with a grade of B or better.

Description: The Bachelor of Science in Business Analytics is an interdisciplinary program designed to prepare students for careers in the growing field of data analytics. This program combines strong foundational knowledge in business, mathematics, statistics, and computer science to develop students' analytical skills. Students will learn to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret large datasets to inform business decisions and solve complex problems. Through hands-on projects and case studies, students will gain proficiency in industry-standard software and techniques, including statistical modeling, machine learning, data visualization, and predictive analytics. Graduates will be equipped to pursue roles such as business intelligence analyst, data analyst, data scientist, and analytics consultant across various industries.
Accredidation: AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
ScholarshipAmount: Awards for first-year students start at $18,000 and go up to $25,000.

EnglishScore: For international students, a minimum TOEFL score of 85 (iBT), an IELTS score of 6.5, a PTE score of 56 or a Duolingo score of 115 is required for direct entry to an undergraduate program. The ELS Level 112 Certificate is also accepted. Students are exempt from this requirement if English is their native language or if they’ve attended a high school where English is the primary mode of instruction for 3 or more years.

Description: The Business Analytics minor provides students with the critical skills and knowledge to solve business problems with data-driven insights using appropriate tools and techniques. The minor exposes students to key topics such as data management, statistical modeling, data visualization, predictive analytics and ethical considerations in data analysis. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will learn to extract meaningful information from complex datasets, interpret results, and communicate findings effectively to various stakeholders. This interdisciplinary minor complements a wide range of majors by enhancing analytical and decision-making capabilities, preparing students for careers in diverse industries such where data-driven strategies are essential.

EnglishScore: International applicants whose primary language is not English are required to take either the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), the Pearson Test of English (PTE) or the Duolingo English Test. Quinnipiac University prefers a minimum TOEFL score of 85 on the internet-based test (iBT), an overall band score of 6.5 on the IELTS, a score of 56 on the PTE Academic, or a score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-year applicants must submit the following: The Common Application, an official high school transcript, one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and a personal essay. Quinnipiac is test-optional for the Bachelor of Science in Chemistry program; applicants may choose whether to submit SAT or ACT scores as part of their application.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Chemistry degree prepares students for careers in industry or government, or for graduate work in chemistry. Students may also complete the American Chemical Society certified curriculum requirements by selecting appropriate electives. The curriculum provides a strong background in chemistry, with a focus on laboratory skills, problem solving and critical thinking. The curriculum has been designed to meet or exceed the requirements for certification by the American Chemical Society.
Accredidation: Certified by the American Chemical Society (ACS)

Description: Students majoring in other fields may elect to complete a minor in Chemistry. This minor provides a foundation in the principles of chemistry and an exposure to the various areas of the field. Students completing a minor in chemistry will be well prepared to pursue careers in a variety of fields and to pursue graduate studies in chemistry or related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their native language are required to demonstrate proficiency in English. Quinnipiac University accepts several methods to prove English proficiency, including: a minimum score of 85 on the TOEFL iBT; a minimum overall band score of 6.5 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 56 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic; or a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: We require the following items to complete your application for admission: The Common Application or the Quinnipiac Application; Official high school transcript(s); A personal essay; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor; A list of your senior year courses.
Description: Civil engineering is the oldest and broadest branch of engineering. Civil engineers design, construct, supervise, operate and maintain infrastructure projects and systems in the public and private sectors, including roads, buildings, airports, tunnels, dams, bridges, and systems for water supply and sewage treatment. They also address problems related to environmental protection, natural disaster prevention and resource management. The BS in Civil Engineering program is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become successful civil engineers. The curriculum combines a strong foundation in mathematics, science and engineering fundamentals with hands-on experience in areas such as structural analysis, geotechnical engineering, transportation engineering, water resources engineering and environmental engineering. Students also develop critical thinking, problem-solving and communication skills, preparing them for a diverse range of career opportunities.
Accredidation: The Civil Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate proficiency by submitting results from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test (DET). This requirement may be waived for students who have completed at least 3 years of secondary education in the United States or at a school where English is the primary language of instruction.
Requirements: Completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, including the essay/personal statement and non-refundable $65 application fee. Official high school transcript(s). One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor who can attest to your academic potential and personal character. A completed Secondary School Report Form, typically submitted by your school counselor.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Communications program provides students with a broad and deep understanding of the diverse fields within communications. Students gain hands-on experience in areas such as digital media production, journalism, public relations, and sports journalism. The program emphasizes critical thinking, ethical communication, and practical skills necessary for success in today’s rapidly evolving media landscape. Through a combination of theoretical coursework and experiential learning opportunities, students learn to analyze, create, and disseminate messages effectively across various platforms. Graduates are prepared for careers in media, public relations, corporate communications, and other communication-intensive fields, or for further graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by submitting scores from at least one of the following: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE or Duolingo. We recommend the following minimum scores: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): a minimum score of 85 on the iBT is recommended. International English Language Testing System (IELTS): a minimum score of 6.5 is recommended. Pearson Test of English (PTE): a minimum score of 56 is recommended. Duolingo English Test (DET): a minimum score of 110 is recommended. Quinnipiac also accepts successful completion of ELS Level 112 as proof of English proficiency.
Requirements: To apply for first-year admission, you will need to submit: A completed Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; Your official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor. We are a test-optional university. You may choose whether or not you’d like to submit your SAT/ACT scores for consideration.
Description: The Computer Information Systems program (CIS) is designed to provide students with the business and technical skills necessary to apply modern information technology to business problems. CIS prepares students for careers in the rapidly growing field of information technology, as well as for graduate study. This program focuses on both the technical and managerial aspects of information systems. Students gain expertise in areas such as programming, database management, network administration, cybersecurity, and project management, all within a business context. The curriculum emphasizes problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills, preparing graduates to be effective leaders and innovators in the digital economy.

The Computer Information Systems (CIS) minor is designed for non-School of Engineering students who are interested in learning fundamental concepts and practices in computing and information systems. The minor will provide students with a foundational understanding of computer programming, database systems, cybersecurity, and data analytics while providing flexibility in the choice of additional CIS courses to meet individual student interests. The CIS minor will equip students with the skills necessary to succeed in a technology-driven world regardless of their major.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems and Accounting
EnglishScore: All applicants for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate a command of the English language. This can be done in a variety of ways, including submission of one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT - minimum total score of 85; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - minimum overall band score of 6.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) - minimum score of 56; Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 110; ELS Language Center - successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: First-year applicants must submit: A completed Common Application, including the essay and a list of your activities; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor. Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT) are optional for most programs.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems and Accounting program prepares students for careers at the intersection of information systems and accounting. This program offers a unique blend of technical and business skills essential for today’s dynamic business environment. Students will gain expertise in areas such as financial accounting, managerial accounting, auditing, taxation, database management, systems analysis and design, cybersecurity, and data analytics. The curriculum is designed to provide a strong foundation in both disciplines, enabling graduates to work effectively with financial data, manage information systems, and contribute to strategic decision-making within organizations. The program emphasizes practical application, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, preparing students for professional certifications like the CPA or relevant technology certifications, as well as for various roles in auditing, financial systems, data analysis, and IT consulting.
Accredidation: The School of Business is accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) - minimum score of 85 on the iBT. IELTS (International English Language Testing System) - minimum score of 6.5. Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 110. Pearson PTE - minimum score of 56.
Requirements: A completed Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Computer Science provides students with the opportunity to master the fundamental theories and applications of computer science as a liberal art. This program is for students with strong interests in other disciplines, such as the humanities or the natural sciences, who wish to combine those interests with a solid understanding of computer science. Students in this program will learn the fundamentals of computer science and apply them in various contexts, preparing them for careers where both quantitative and qualitative skills are vital. Graduates will be equipped to pursue entry-level positions in technology, computational fields, and related interdisciplinary areas, or to continue their education at the graduate level.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by providing the results from an English language proficiency test. Quinnipiac University accepts the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT - recommended score of 85 or higher; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - recommended score of 6.5 or higher; Duolingo English Test - recommended score of 110 or higher; Pearson Test of English (PTE) - recommended score of 56 or higher.
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need: The Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, official high school transcript(s), a personal essay, one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and a list of senior year courses. Quinnipiac is a test-optional university, which means applicants are not required to submit SAT or ACT scores as part of the application for admission.
Description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Computer Science program at Quinnipiac provides students with a strong foundation in both the theoretical and practical aspects of computing. The curriculum emphasizes problem-solving, algorithm design, software development, data structures, and computer organization. Students gain expertise in programming languages, operating systems, networking, databases, and cybersecurity. The program prepares graduates for a wide range of careers in the technology industry, including software engineering, data analysis, cybersecurity, and web development. The curriculum also provides a solid foundation for graduate studies in computer science or related fields. Students will develop critical thinking skills, problem-solving abilities, and an understanding of ethical considerations in computing. A robust capstone experience allows students to apply their knowledge to real-world projects.

Requirements: To be admitted to the minor, students must have completed CSC 110 with a grade of C or better. A minimum grade of 'C' is required for all courses in the minor.
Description: A minor in computer science is an excellent way to broaden a student’s understanding of technology and computational thinking. It provides students with fundamental knowledge and skills in programming, data structures, algorithms, and other core areas of computer science. This minor complements a wide range of majors, allowing students to integrate computational skills into their primary field of study. By completing the minor, students enhance their problem-solving abilities, logical reasoning, and adaptability to new technologies, making them more competitive in today’s technology-driven world.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Criminal Justice
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency examination. We accept the TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo English Test (DET) and Pearson PTE. We also accept ELS Level 112 as proof of English proficiency. The English proficiency examination requirement is waived if the applicant's native language is English, or if the applicant has attended a U.S. high school or a high school abroad where English is the primary language of instruction for three or more years and has a B average in their English courses.
Requirements: To apply as a first-year applicant, you will need: a completed Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; your official high school transcript; and a letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher. Test scores (SAT/ACT) are optional for most programs.
Concentration: Criminal Justice and Law, Forensic Investigations
Description:
The Criminal Justice program introduces students to the nature and causes of crime, patterns of crime, the organization and administration of law enforcement agencies, the legal process, the correctional system and theories of criminal justice. The interdisciplinary nature of the curriculum provides students with a broad understanding of the field and its application to diverse issues, including policy formation, law enforcement, evidence, forensic science, the courts and correctional systems. Through the interdisciplinary curriculum, students acquire knowledge and skills in critical thinking, research, problem-solving and communication. Students are provided with the necessary skills to assess the needs of their communities, to develop effective programs and to implement and evaluate social policy. The program also provides excellent preparation for further study in graduate school or law school.
Students pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Criminal Justice must select one of the following specializations: Criminal Justice and Law or Forensic Investigations.
Through internships, opportunities for engagement with the community, service learning and research, the criminal justice program connects students with their communities and provides them with real-world experiences. Students are challenged to use classroom knowledge and apply it to a wide range of social issues through problem solving, leadership and the use of technology.

Requirements: A minimum of 18 credits is required for the minor as outlined below. A grade of C or better is required in all courses for the minor. Students must complete a minimum of 12 credits in the minor at Quinnipiac University. One course in the minor may be used to satisfy a University Curriculum requirement.
Description: The Criminal Justice minor is for students interested in a career in criminal justice. The courses offered prepare students for employment with law enforcement agencies (local, state and federal), correctional facilities, probation and parole, and other public and private agencies in the criminal justice system. The minor also prepares students for graduate studies in criminal justice, law school and other related fields. Students will gain an understanding of criminal justice issues related to theory, policy and research. The Criminal Justice minor is open to all students, regardless of major. Students interested in the minor should contact the department chair or program coordinator to discuss their interests.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Data Science
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate a satisfactory level of proficiency in the English language. A minimum score of 85 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 110 on the Duolingo English Test, or 56 on the PTE Academic is required. Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center also satisfies this requirement.
Requirements: Applicants are required to submit the Common Application. Required application materials include an official high school transcript, one letter of recommendation (up to two accepted), and a personal essay submitted through the Common Application. Quinnipiac is a test-optional institution, and the submission of SAT or ACT scores is not required for admission to the BS in Data Science program.
Description: Data scientists are expert analytical practitioners who combine a strong background in mathematics and computer science with skills in statistics, visualization and communication to extract insights from data. Our bachelor of science in Data Science program prepares students for careers in this rapidly growing field. Students in the Data Science program acquire the mathematical and computational foundations necessary to work with data and develop expertise in data acquisition, management, modeling, analysis and visualization. The program also provides students with the critical thinking and communication skills necessary to formulate and articulate data-driven solutions to real-world problems. The BS in Data Science can also provide an excellent foundation for graduate study in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Diagnostic Medical Sonography
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by submitting scores from one of the following exams: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo English Test or Pearson Test of English (PTE). This requirement may be waived for students who have attended a high school in the United States or another English-speaking country for at least 3 years and have demonstrated strong academic English skills in their coursework.
Requirements: First-year applicants are required to submit the Common Application, an official high school transcript, and one letter of recommendation. Quinnipiac is a test-optional university, so applicants may choose whether or not to submit SAT or ACT scores. For entry into the professional phase of the program, current students must submit a separate application. The criteria for selection into the professional phase includes a cumulative GPA of 3.000 or greater, prerequisite GPA of 3.000 or greater, an interview, an essay, and completion of all prerequisite and first-year coursework.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Diagnostic Medical Sonography program prepares students for careers as diagnostic medical sonographers. The program consists of a three-year pre-professional phase followed by a 15-month professional phase during which students complete courses in the Diagnostic Medical Sonography major and extensive clinical practice. Upon completion of the program, graduates are eligible to take national board examinations offered by the American Registry for Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS). Graduates are prepared to work as entry-level sonographers in hospitals, clinics, or private offices and function as members of the health care team. The curriculum emphasizes patient care, professionalism, effective communication, critical thinking, problem solving, and skills necessary to obtain high quality diagnostic images and effectively evaluate images for clinical information. Students are provided with a foundation in the basic sciences as well as general education courses that broaden knowledge and enhance communication skills. The program provides students with the clinical education necessary for advanced professional practice through partnerships with diverse clinical sites.
Accredidation: The Diagnostic Medical Sonography program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (JRCDMS).

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to demonstrate proof of English proficiency by providing the results from at least one of the following: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo or PTE Academic. The English proficiency testing requirement may be waived for applicants who are native English speakers or who have attended a secondary school where the language of instruction is English for 3 or more years and are enrolled in a non-ESL English/literature course. Quinnipiac University also recognizes the successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To apply, prospective first-year students will need to submit: Common Application or Quinnipiac Application; Official high school transcript(s); Counselor/teacher recommendation; Personal essay; $65 nonrefundable application fee or fee waiver.
Description: Economics is the study of how societies manage their scarce resources. Economists use a variety of tools, including statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and historical research, to understand and address real-world problems. The BS in Economics provides students with a strong foundation in economic theory, quantitative methods and analytical skills. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for careers in finance, government, consulting and various other fields, as well as for graduate study in economics, law or business. The program’s rigorous approach to economic analysis and empirical research fosters critical thinking, problem-solving abilities and effective communication skills.

Requirements: Students are required to complete the following courses. A minimum grade of C is required for all courses in the minor.
Description: The Department of Economics offers a minor in Economics. The study of economics provides an analytical understanding of how institutions operate to influence economic activity and welfare. The minor is a valuable complement to many majors in both the arts and sciences and business, providing students with analytical skills that can be applied to a wide range of career options and advanced study. Students who select the minor will take at least 18 credits in economics, including courses in microeconomics, macroeconomics, and statistics.

EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be done by submitting official TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson PTE or Duolingo English Test (DET) scores, successfully completing an ELS Language Centers level 112 course, attending a high school where the primary language of instruction for your most recent 3 years has been English, or by submitting an SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing score of 550 or higher or an ACT English score of 23 or higher.
Requirements: To apply, you will need: A completed Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; Official high school transcript(s) from all secondary schools attended; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor. Standardized Test Scores (optional for most programs).
Description:
Our Bachelor of Arts in English program equips students to think, read, speak and write with clarity, creativity and conviction. Through a wide variety of courses, you’ll develop the skills to analyze different modes of expression — literary, rhetorical and visual — from different historical periods and cultural contexts. You’ll investigate how language shapes and reflects the human experience, and you’ll learn how to express your own ideas effectively.
Our curriculum is designed to help you strengthen your ability to read critically and write persuasively. You’ll be able to shape your education around your interests, choosing from courses in British, American, and global literature, as well as creative writing, rhetoric and linguistics. You’ll apply diverse theoretical frameworks to interpret literary texts and cultural artifacts, and you’ll conduct research using both traditional and digital tools. You’ll also learn to communicate effectively in a variety of contexts and for a variety of purposes.
An English degree from Quinnipiac has a strong track record of preparing graduates for a broad range of rewarding careers and graduate study. Our graduates possess highly marketable skills—strong writing, communication, and critical thinking—that employers seek across diverse industries, from publishing and journalism to law, education, and business.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Entrepreneurship and Innovation
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. You may do so by submitting one of the following: an official TOEFL score report with a minimum score of 85 on the internet-based test (iBT); an official IELTS score report with a minimum score of 6.5; an official PTE Academic score report with a minimum score of 56; an official Duolingo English Test (DET) report with a minimum score of 110; or through successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.
Requirements: When reviewing your application for admission, we will conduct a holistic review of your academic and personal credentials. This means we will consider your high school transcript, letters of recommendation, personal essay and your extracurricular involvement.
Description: Quinnipiac’s BS in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management program helps students develop skills in innovation, creativity, opportunity recognition and evaluation, resource acquisition, and venture initiation. Students will learn how to identify opportunities, develop business plans, raise capital, and manage and grow a new venture. In addition, students will learn how to manage and grow a small business, including topics such as marketing, finance, operations, and human resources. This program prepares students for a variety of careers in entrepreneurship, including starting their own businesses, working for startups, or working in small businesses.

EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their first language are required to submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met in any one of the following ways: TOEFL: minimum score of 85 (iBT); IELTS: minimum score of 6.5; PTE: minimum score of 56; Duolingo English Test (DET): minimum score of 115; ELS Language Center: successful completion of Level 112.
Requirements: The Minor in Entrepreneurship and Innovation (E&I) is open to all university students.
Description: The Minor in Entrepreneurship and Innovation prepares students from any major to address challenges and pursue opportunities through innovative, entrepreneurial problem solving. Students learn skills to develop, launch, and manage new ventures within corporations (intrapreneurship), for non-profits (social entrepreneurship), or as an independent business. The minor provides an experiential learning approach where students move from idea generation to a launch of a new product, service, or business model through a lean startup process. Students will apply skills in design thinking, problem framing, market validation, business model development, financial forecasting, and pitch development. The minor provides students with the capability to create new value in their chosen career path by leveraging innovation and entrepreneurial thinking.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Environmental Science
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated in any one of the following ways: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 85 on the internet-based test (iBT). International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum overall score of 6.5. Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 110. Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 56. Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center (ELS).
Requirements: Required Application Materials: Common Application; Official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher; Test scores (optional); Essay, submitted via the Common Application.
Department: The College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Environmental Science provides students with the scientific knowledge and practical skills necessary to understand and address complex environmental problems. The curriculum integrates principles from biology, chemistry, geology, and physics with specialized courses in environmental policy, sustainability, and data analysis. Students develop critical thinking skills through hands-on laboratory work, field experiences, and research projects. The program prepares graduates for diverse careers in environmental consulting, natural resource management, conservation, environmental education, and government agencies, as well as for further graduate studies in environmental fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Environmental Studies
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate a command of the language to be successful in our academic programs. This can be done in one of the following ways: TOEFL: a minimum score of 85 on the internet-based exam (iBT). Quinnipiac’s TOEFL code is 3712. IELTS: a minimum score of 6.5. Duolingo English Test: a minimum score of 110. Pearson PTE: a minimum score of 56. Successful completion of the ELS Language Center’s Level 112.
Requirements: Completed Common Application, Official high school transcript(s), One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, Personal essay (included in the Common Application), $65 nonrefundable application fee or fee waiver.
Description:
Environmental Studies is an interdisciplinary program that draws upon the natural sciences, social sciences and humanities. The goal of the program is to educate students in the scientific principles necessary to understand environmental systems, to provide a social, political and economic context in which to evaluate policy options, and to encourage critical thinking about the human place in the natural world. Students completing the BA in Environmental Studies should be able to:
* Evaluate competing claims about environmental issues from diverse disciplinary perspectives.
* Utilize the tools of scientific inquiry to analyze environmental problems.
* Articulate the societal factors shaping human-environment interactions.
* Formulate and defend solutions to environmental problems.
* Communicate effectively about environmental issues.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Exercise Science
EnglishScore: All international applicants for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate proficiency in English. Quinnipiac accepts the TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), PTE (Pearson Test of English) or the Duolingo English Test. Minimum scores required for consideration: TOEFL: 85 (iBT), IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 56, Duolingo: 115. Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112 also satisfies this requirement.
Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit the following: The Common Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor, and an essay (included in the Common Application).
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Exercise Science program provides students with the foundational knowledge and skills necessary for careers in various health, fitness, and sport performance settings, as well as for graduate studies in fields such as physical therapy, occupational therapy, physician assistant, chiropractic, exercise physiology, biomechanics, and strength and conditioning. The curriculum integrates theoretical knowledge with practical application through hands-on experiences, research opportunities, and clinical internships. Students learn about human anatomy and physiology, exercise physiology, biomechanics, motor learning, nutrition, and exercise testing and prescription. They develop critical thinking skills, evidence-based practice, and effective communication to assess, design, and implement exercise programs for diverse populations, including healthy individuals, athletes, and those with chronic diseases.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Film, Television and Media Arts
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the following examinations and scores: TOEFL: Minimum score of 85 (iBT), IELTS: Minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test (DET): Minimum score of 110, Pearson Test of English (PTE): Minimum score of 56, ELS Language Center: Successful completion of Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit: The Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor, and a personal essay.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Film, Television and Media Arts is designed for students seeking careers as creators and producers of content for these dynamic media industries. The curriculum balances a strong theoretical and critical foundation with the development of practical and creative skills required for storytelling across a range of genres and platforms. Students learn to conceptualize, write, shoot, direct, edit and produce films, television shows and digital content, as well as critically analyze their forms, aesthetics, production and reception. Students explore topics such as film history, television studies, media theory, screenwriting, cinematography, directing, editing, sound design, producing, and new media production. The program emphasizes ethical and socially responsible practices, preparing graduates to be innovative and impactful storytellers in a rapidly evolving media landscape.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based (Trustee, Presidential, Dean's Scholarships), Need-based (Quinnipiac Grants)

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to demonstrate your proficiency. Quinnipiac accepts TOEFL iBT (minimum score of 85), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), Duolingo English Test (DET) (minimum score of 110), PTE (minimum score of 56), or completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Description: The minor in film and television offers students opportunities to develop skills in film and video production and/or critical studies of film and television. Students learn the basic technical and aesthetic principles of video production and editing in the production track, and acquire critical language and theory through the critical studies track. Students completing the minor will have a portfolio of written work, video projects, or both. The minor requires six courses. Students may choose to complete a production track or a critical studies track. Students may apply a maximum of three courses from the minor toward completion of another major or minor.

EnglishScore: For applicants for whom English is not their first language, proof of English language proficiency is required. Accepted proofs include: TOEFL iBT minimum score of 85, IELTS minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test (DET) minimum score of 115, PTE Academic minimum score of 56, or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center. The requirement may be waived for students who attended a U.S. high school for at least 3 years or completed secondary education where English is the official language of instruction.
Requirements: Your completed application for admission will include: The Common Application or Quinnipiac University Application, including the Quinnipiac-specific questions; Your official high school transcript; A letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor; A personal essay; A nonrefundable application fee of $65; SAT or ACT scores (optional).
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Finance program offers students a comprehensive understanding of financial markets, institutions, and instruments. Students develop analytical and problem-solving skills essential for careers in corporate finance, investment management, banking, and financial planning. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in economic principles, quantitative methods, and financial theory. Graduates are prepared for a variety of roles in the financial industry, including financial analysts, portfolio managers, risk managers, and financial advisors, as well as for further graduate studies.
Accredidation: AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business

Requirements:
Students must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.000 to declare a business minor.

Prerequisites: AC 201, EC 111, EC 112, MT 141 (or higher).
Description: The minor in finance is designed for business majors and nonbusiness majors who wish to develop skills in financial management and analytical decision-making. The program emphasizes an applied approach that will benefit students interested in careers in financial services, corporate finance or personal financial planning.

The minor in fine arts provides students from all disciplines the opportunity to develop their creative and critical skills through engagement with the principles and practices of the visual arts. Students will be encouraged to explore both traditional and new media and to develop proficiency in a broad range of materials and techniques. The goal of the minor is to foster students' aesthetic awareness and to cultivate their ability to create and interpret works of art.

EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by providing the results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test. Our minimum score for the TOEFL is 85. Our minimum score for the IELTS is 6.5. Our minimum score for the PTE is 56. Our minimum score for the Duolingo English Test is 115. The English proficiency testing requirement may be waived for students who have attended a U.S. high school for at least three years and have earned passing grades in three years of standard, college-prep English (not ESL) courses, or who are from a country where the native language is English.
Requirements:

Description: The forensic science minor is intended for students who have an interest in combining a science major with a basic understanding of forensic applications of chemistry, biology and criminalistics. The goal of the minor is to provide students with the laboratory and theoretical skills and knowledge that are critical for scientific analysis in criminal and civil investigations. Students pursuing this minor will gain proficiency in a variety of scientific disciplines with an emphasis on forensic applications of basic scientific principles.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Game Design and Development
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts a minimum score of 85 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), a minimum overall score of 6.5 on the IELTS, a minimum score of 56 on the PTE Academic, or a minimum score of 115 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit: A completed Quinnipiac Application or Common Application, along with a $65 application fee or fee waiver; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor; Personal essay.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Game Design and Development focuses on the skills and knowledge needed to design, develop, and produce video games across a variety of platforms and genres. The curriculum combines the theoretical foundations of game design with practical, hands-on experience in game development, including programming, art, animation, sound design, and project management. Students learn to critically analyze games, understand player psychology, and apply design principles to create engaging and innovative interactive experiences. Emphasizing creativity, collaboration, and problem-solving, the program prepares graduates for careers in the dynamic and evolving game industry, as well as for further study in related fields.

ProgramName: Minor in Game Design and Development
