Description: The minor in game design and development is intended for students who wish to learn about and engage in the design, development and production of video games in an interdisciplinary setting. This minor will help students develop skills relevant to the current job market in game design and related industries. Students will develop foundational skills in game development across many areas including design, art, programming, production and sound design. This minor provides an opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge to practical projects as students learn to work in interdisciplinary teams. The minor will help students prepare for careers as game designers, game artists, game programmers, quality assurance testers, level designers, UI/UX designers or game producers.

Requirements: A minor in general business is available to students in all undergraduate schools and colleges except the School of Business. The minor consists of 18 credits. Students must earn a minimum GPA of 2.000 in the minor.
Description: The General Business minor helps students from outside the School of Business develop valuable knowledge and skills that are essential in today’s complex business environment. This 18-credit minor provides students with a fundamental understanding of business principles and practices, preparing them for a wide range of career opportunities or for graduate studies.

EnglishScore: All international applicants are required to provide proof of English language proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the TOEFL (minimum 85 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo English Test (DET) (minimum 115), and the Pearson Test of English (PTE) (minimum 56). Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center also fulfills this requirement. The requirement may be waived for students who meet certain criteria, such as attending a U.S. high school for at least three years.
Requirements: Completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor; Personal Essay.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Gerontology program at Quinnipiac University offers students an interdisciplinary education focused on the study of aging. This program integrates knowledge from various fields including sociology, psychology, biology, and public health to provide a comprehensive understanding of the physical, mental, and social aspects of aging. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in social work, healthcare administration, non-profit organizations, and public policy, working with older adults and their families. Students will develop skills in critical analysis, research, and program planning, equipping them to address the challenges and opportunities presented by an aging population.

Requirements: To declare a minor in global public health, students must have a minimum GPA of 2.500 and must complete a declaration of minor form, available from the registrar. Students may substitute up to two courses with prior approval of the program director.
Description: The Global Public Health minor will introduce students to the key concepts, theories and evidence related to public health problems and solutions at a global level. Students will develop an understanding of the determinants of health and disease, the historical and contemporary challenges in global health, the role of public health policies and programs, and the ethical considerations involved in addressing global health issues. The minor will provide students with an interdisciplinary perspective on global health, drawing on knowledge from various fields such as epidemiology, environmental health, social sciences, health policy and economics. Students will gain critical thinking skills, cultural competence and a global perspective to analyze complex health challenges and contribute to their solutions. The Global Public Health minor will prepare students for a range of career paths in public health, international development, research and policy, and will also complement a variety of majors by providing students with a valuable skill set and knowledge base for engaging with global health issues.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Graphic and Interactive Design
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to demonstrate your proficiency. We accept the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): A minimum score of 85 on the internet-based test (iBT). International English Language Testing System (IELTS): A minimum score of 6.5. Duolingo English Test (DET): A minimum score of 110. Pearson Test of English (PTE): A minimum score of 56. ELS Language Centers: Successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit: The Common Application or Quinnipiac Application; Your official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher; Personal Essay (as part of the Common Application or Quinnipiac Application).
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Graphic and Interactive Design is a STEM-designated program that prepares students for careers as designers, user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) professionals, and creative artists who seek to shape the world through visual communication and human-centered design. Students learn the foundational skills and theories necessary for visual design, digital media, typography, and interactive experience, as well as the broader context of design’s role in society. The curriculum emphasizes both creative practice and critical thinking, encouraging students to develop innovative solutions for real-world problems. Graduates will be equipped to work in a variety of industries, including advertising, marketing, web design, app development, game design, and more, as well as to pursue graduate studies in design or related fields.

Health care management is concerned with providing leadership and direction to organizations that deliver health care. This minor prepares students for careers in the rapidly growing and changing health care industry. It provides students with a foundational understanding of the complexities of the health care system and the skills necessary for effective management within it. Students will learn about health care policy, finance, economics, organizational behavior, marketing, and the legal and ethical issues facing health care managers. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills relevant to health care organizations.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 85, a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Duolingo score of 110, a minimum Pearson PTE score of 56, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Students are required to complete a minimum of 18 credits. At least 9 credits must be at the 300 level or above. All courses must be completed with a grade of C or better.
Description: The Health Equity Minor is a 15-credit interdisciplinary program focused on understanding the social, economic, environmental, and political determinants of health; health inequities; and strategies to promote health equity among populations. The minor is a valuable complement to students’ major fields of study, preparing them for careers in health and human services, government, education, and other sectors that address population health and social justice. The minor provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in public health, health administration, social work, law, and related fields. The minor combines core courses in the areas of health equity and public health with elective courses that allow students to explore topics of particular interest or relevance to their major.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Health, Medicine, and Society
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: minimum score of 85 (iBT), IELTS: minimum score of 6.5, PTE: minimum score of 56, Duolingo: minimum score of 115, Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-year applicants must submit: The Common Application, including the essay and a list of your activities. Official high school transcript. Two letters of recommendation, including one from your school counselor and one from a teacher who has taught you in an academic course.
Description: Quinnipiac's Bachelor of Arts in Health, Medicine and Society program is an interdisciplinary approach to studying the social, cultural and historical factors that shape health, medicine and illness. The program prepares students for a diverse range of careers in health-related fields, including public health, health policy, health advocacy, social work, medical ethics, and health communication, as well as for graduate study in social and behavioral sciences and health professions. Courses draw from disciplines in the humanities and social sciences to examine topics such as global health disparities, the social determinants of health, the cultural meanings of disease, and ethical issues in healthcare. The program aims to foster critical thinking, ethical reasoning, and cross-cultural understanding, equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary to address complex health challenges in a rapidly changing world.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Health Science Studies
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for international applicants. One of the following test scores is needed to satisfy this requirement: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL iBT) with a minimum score of 85; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 110; Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) with a minimum score of 56.
Requirements: The Office of Undergraduate Admissions reviews all applications for this program. Required materials for first-year applicants include: The Common Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation (from a school counselor, teacher or someone who can speak to your academic potential), and a personal essay.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Health Science Studies degree offers students the opportunity to explore the various fields of health, disease, and the healthcare delivery system from a multidisciplinary perspective. This degree provides students with a foundational curriculum in biological, physical, behavioral, and social sciences as applied to health, disease, and the healthcare delivery system. This program also allows students to take electives and/or a minor in order to specialize within particular areas of health such as Public Health, Global Health, Exercise Science, Health Policy, etc. The Health Science Studies program will prepare students for graduate studies in a variety of health-related fields, including Public Health, Healthcare Management, Exercise Science, Global Health, Health Education, Physician Assistant, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Athletic Training, Chiropractic, Nursing and Medicine. The Health Science Studies program also prepares students for entry-level careers in public health, community health, allied health, and other non-clinical health-related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Hispanic and Latin American Studies
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, Quinnipiac requires one of the following: TOEFL: score of 85 or higher on the iBT; IELTS: score of 6.5 or higher; PTE: score of 56 or higher; Duolingo English Test (DET): score of 105 or higher. The English language proficiency test requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a high school diploma from an institution in the United States, United Kingdom, Republic of Ireland, Australia, New Zealand or Canada (excluding Quebec), or for students who have completed at least two years of study at such an institution.
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need: The Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, your official high school transcript, a letter of recommendation, and an essay or personal statement. We also require a list of your senior year courses and a $65 nonrefundable application fee or fee waiver.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Hispanic and Latin American Studies is a vibrant interdisciplinary program in the College of Arts and Sciences. Our students become global citizens through a deep and rich study of the Spanish language, and the diverse cultures, histories, literatures and contemporary issues of Spain, Latin America and U.S. Latinx communities. Students engage in discussions of pressing global issues as they relate to social justice, politics, human rights, economic development, arts and media, and the environment. Students are strongly encouraged to pursue study abroad opportunities in a Spanish-speaking country. Graduates are prepared for a wide range of careers in fields such as global business, communications, government, law, education, health sciences, social work, non-profit organizations, international relations and graduate studies.

ProgramName: Minor in Hispanic and Latin American Studies
Description: Upon successful completion of the Minor in Hispanic and Latin American Studies, students will be able to: Communicate with proficiency in Spanish across a wide range of topics both orally and in writing. Employ linguistic and cultural knowledge to engage with Hispanic and Latin American communities and critically assess their own roles in a globalized world. Analyze and interpret the historical and cultural forces that shape Hispanic and Latin American societies and their diasporas.

EnglishScore: Students whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be fulfilled by submitting minimum scores on the TOEFL (85 iBT), IELTS (6.5), PTE (56), or Duolingo English Test (110). Other options for fulfilling the requirement include successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center, obtaining specific scores on the SAT or ACT English sections, or completing certain college-level credits at a U.S. institution.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-year applicants must submit the following: a completed Common Application, an official high school transcript, a Secondary School Report form, one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and a personal essay. Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT) are optional.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in History is offered through the College of Arts and Sciences. Our students explore the complex processes of human interaction, social change and political activity through a detailed analysis of the past. The history major will develop a critical understanding of human experience through the lenses of political, social, economic, cultural, and intellectual history. They develop strong analytical, research, and communication skills which prepares them for careers in fields such as law, education, journalism, public service, and business.

The History minor provides students with the critical skills they need to analyze and interpret the past while helping them understand the present. They learn to evaluate historical evidence, construct arguments, and communicate their ideas effectively. The minor offers a broad foundation in historical knowledge and prepares students for a variety of careers or for further study.

ProgramName: Minor in History and Philosophy of Science

Requirements: A minor in human movement is not available to athletic training or health science studies majors.
Description: The minor in Human Movement provides students with a foundational understanding of the anatomy and physiology of human movement. Coursework emphasizes the study of exercise science, including biomechanics, motor control, and exercise physiology. Students also gain hands-on experience through laboratory coursework focused on the assessment and analysis of human movement.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Human Resource Management
EnglishScore: All international applicants are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. One of the following test results is required: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): minimum score of 85 on the IBT; International English Language Testing System (IELTS): minimum overall band score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test: minimum score of 110; PTE Academic: minimum score of 56. The English proficiency testing requirement can be waived for students who have studied in the United States or other English-speaking countries for two or more years, and students who are enrolled in an IB curriculum.
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, the following is required: a completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, including your personal essay; your official high school transcript(s); and one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor. Official SAT or ACT scores are optional for the Bachelor of Science in Human Resource Management program.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Individualized Major
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted methods include submitting official results from TOEFL iBT (recommended score: 85), IELTS (recommended score: 6.5), PTE (recommended score: 56), or Duolingo English Test (recommended score: 115). Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center is also accepted. Applicants may be exempt from this requirement if they meet certain criteria.
Requirements: Students can apply using the Common Application. In addition to the application, we require: Your official high school transcript; A personal essay; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor. Quinnipiac is a test-optional university for all majors, which means you have the choice of whether to submit SAT or ACT scores. We do not require the optional Essay section of the SAT or the optional Writing section of the ACT.
Description: Students who pursue an individualized major have the opportunity to design their own course of study with the help of a faculty advisor. An individualized major allows students to integrate courses from different departments or schools that are not offered within existing majors at the university. This option is available to students who have already declared a major, but who have discovered an area of interest that cannot be pursued within one of the existing majors offered at Quinnipiac. Individualized majors must be at least 36 credits and must be approved by the Individualized Major Committee. The mission of the individualized major is to facilitate the educational goals of highly motivated students who wish to pursue an interdisciplinary course of study that cannot be accomplished within existing major programs.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Individualized Major
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to demonstrate your English proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the following methods of demonstrating English language proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL iBT) with a score of 85 or higher; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a score of 6.5 or higher; Duolingo English Test (DET) with a score of 110 or higher; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a score of 56 or higher; Successful completion of an ELS Language Center’s English for Academic Purposes Program by completing Level 112; Successful completion of 2 or more years of study in a secondary school or 1 or more years of study in a college or university in the U.S. or other English-speaking countries.
Requirements: First-year applicants must submit a completed application (either the Common Application or the Quinnipiac Application), an official high school transcript, one essay, and one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor. Quinnipiac is a test-optional university, which means you have the choice of whether or not to submit SAT or ACT scores as part of your application for admission.
Description: The Individualized Major is a program for students who wish to design their own major or combine two or more existing majors. It allows students to pursue their unique interests while developing a coherent and rigorous academic plan. Students work closely with faculty advisors to create a curriculum tailored to their specific goals, which may include interdisciplinary studies, unique career paths, or preparation for advanced graduate study. The program emphasizes critical thinking, research skills, and effective communication, preparing students for diverse professional and academic opportunities.

Requirements: The student must submit a proposal that includes a title for the minor, a statement of purpose for the minor, a proposed list of at least five courses that will fulfill the minor, and a completion plan. The individualized minor proposal must be endorsed by a full-time faculty member who has agreed to serve as the minor adviser and approved by the appropriate dean or designee. Students must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.500 to declare an individualized minor. Proposals must be submitted before the student has completed 90 credits.
Description: An individualized minor is designed by a student in consultation with an adviser from each of the participating departments and approved by the dean of the student’s school and the dean of the school offering the individualized minor. Students are encouraged to pursue such a minor to enhance their major field of study, to provide breadth to their education, or to explore areas of interdisciplinary interest. Students proposing an individualized minor must: 1. Have completed at least 30 credits at Quinnipiac and have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.75. 2. Meet with a faculty adviser from each of the participating departments to develop a program of study consisting of a minimum of 18 credits with at least 12 credits at the 200-level or above. No more than six credits from the student’s major may count toward the individualized minor. 3. Submit a proposal for the individualized minor to the academic dean of their major school for review and approval no later than the completion of 75 credits. The proposal must include: A completed Individualized Minor Planning Form signed by the student, adviser(s) from the participating department(s), and the dean of the school offering the individualized minor. A current advising report. A statement written by the student explaining the academic purpose of the individualized minor and how it will enhance the student’s major or provide breadth to the student’s education. A list of proposed courses including course numbers, titles, and credit hours. An explanation of how the courses are connected to one another to create a cohesive academic experience. 4. Maintain a minimum GPA of 2.0 in the individualized minor.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by submitting scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test (DET). Minimum Score Requirements: TOEFL: 85 (internet-based), IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 56, Duolingo English Test (DET): 110.

Applicants must submit official high school transcript(s) showing a strong college-preparatory curriculum. Applicants to the School of Engineering are expected to have completed 4 years of mathematics (through pre-calculus or calculus) and 1 year of both chemistry and physics. A minimum of 1 letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor is required, though up to 3 are accepted.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate their English language proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the following examinations and requires the minimum score as indicated: TOEFL iBT: minimum score of 85, IELTS: minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo: minimum score of 115, Pearson PTE: minimum score of 56. Successful completion of ELS Level 112 will also satisfy the English language proficiency requirement.
Requirements: First-year applicants must submit: a completed application (either the Common Application or the Quinnipiac Application), an official high school transcript, one letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher, and a personal essay.
Description: Interdisciplinary Studies is a liberal arts degree offered through the College of Arts and Sciences. The BA in Interdisciplinary Studies allows students to develop a program of study that combines two or more traditional disciplines, areas of study, or pre-professional programs offered at the University. Working with faculty advisors, students develop a unique, personalized course of study tailored to their individual interests and career goals. This program is for students who want to develop a broad knowledge base that incorporates multiple areas of study and apply critical thinking skills to complex problems. Graduates of the program are prepared for diverse careers in a variety of fields and for advanced study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies
EnglishScore: All international applicants for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate an appropriate level of proficiency in the English language. This can be met by submitting test scores from any of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: Completed Common Application, Official high school transcript(s), One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, Personal essay, Secondary School Report form, $65 nonrefundable application fee or fee waiver.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies is a flexible degree completion program designed for adult learners who wish to complete a bachelor's degree at Quinnipiac University. Students work with an advisor to craft a unique course of study around an individualized theme, which allows them to combine credits from previous coursework and learning experiences with new courses taken at Quinnipiac. Students may also complete a minor. The program enables students to pursue their academic interests in a flexible, accessible, and supportive environment. This degree is designed to help adult learners achieve their personal and professional goals through a self-designed course of study, allowing them to draw connections across multiple disciplines.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in International Business
EnglishScore: Quinnipiac University requires all applicants whose first language is not English to demonstrate a command of the language. TOEFL, IELTS or Duolingo English Test (DET) scores are required for all international applicants whose native language is not English. Quinnipiac also accepts the Pearson Test of English (PTE). In lieu of the TOEFL, IELTS, DET or PTE, Quinnipiac also accepts completion of the ELS Language Center’s Level 112 with a grade of at least B (3.000).
Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit the Common Application, including the personal essay, an official high school transcript, and one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor.
Description: International business continues to grow as the world becomes more interconnected and companies seek global opportunities. The International Business program provides students with the critical skills and knowledge needed to succeed in global careers. The curriculum is interdisciplinary, blending business core courses with international studies, economics, culture and language courses. Students develop a global perspective, cross-cultural understanding, and the ability to navigate complex international business environments. The program prepares graduates for a variety of roles in multinational corporations, international organizations, government agencies, and entrepreneurial ventures with a global focus.

The Minor in International Business is designed for students who want to develop an understanding of the global business environment. This interdisciplinary minor prepares students to analyze and navigate the complexities of international trade, finance, and cultural differences. Students will gain insights into global markets, international management strategies, and the impact of geopolitics on business decisions, enhancing their career prospects in an increasingly interconnected world.

The minor in International Studies requires 18 credits in International Studies courses or approved courses outside the International Studies program. The minor helps students develop an understanding of the interconnected nature of the global economy, politics, and culture. The minor requires a minimum of three credits at the 300-level or above. Students must consult with the International Studies program coordinator before registering for courses in the minor.

Requirements: A completed Common Application or Quinnipiac University Application, including the essay and a list of your activities. Your official high school transcript. One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Journalism program prepares students for careers as journalists in a variety of media, including print, broadcast, and online. Students learn to research, report, write, edit, and produce journalistic content with a strong emphasis on ethical practices and critical thinking. The curriculum combines foundational courses in journalism principles with hands-on experience in multimedia storytelling, data journalism, investigative reporting, and convergent media production. Graduates are equipped with the skills necessary to adapt to the evolving media landscape and to contribute to informed public discourse.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Justice and Community Engagement
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by submitting scores from one of the following exams: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE), Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you are required to submit the following: Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac questions; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor.
Description: Justice and Community Engagement, BA is an interdisciplinary program designed to prepare students to understand the causes and consequences of injustice, explore pathways for positive social change and develop skills for community engagement. The curriculum emphasizes critical inquiry, ethical reasoning, and practical application, providing students with the knowledge and tools necessary to address complex social issues.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Law in Society
EnglishScore: If English is not your first language, you are required to submit proof of English proficiency. We accept the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): minimum score of 85 on the internet-based test (iBT). International English Language Testing System (IELTS): minimum score of 6.5 on the academic module. Duolingo English Test (DET): minimum score of 115. ELS Language Center: successful completion of Level 112. The English proficiency requirement may be waived if you have completed at least two years of study in a high school where the primary language of instruction is English or if you submit an SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing score of 550 or higher or an ACT English score of 21 or higher.

A personal essay is also a required part of the application.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Law in Society explores the various ways that law shapes and is shaped by our society. Students will engage with historical, political, philosophical, ethical, and sociological questions related to the law. The Law in Society program is designed for students interested in law school, graduate school, or careers in law-related fields such as paralegal, policy analyst, criminal justice, or government.

Description: The Minor in Management provides students with an understanding of basic management concepts and practices to prepare them for leadership roles in any organization. Students will explore topics such as ethical decision-making, global management, human resource management, organizational behavior, and strategic management, and will learn how to apply these concepts in a variety of business and organizational settings. The minor is a valuable addition to any major, providing a foundation in management that complements a wide range of academic interests and career goals.

Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need to submit: The Common Application, including the essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions. Official high school transcript(s). One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in marketing provides students with a strong foundation in contemporary marketing theory and practice, preparing them for a variety of careers in business, nonprofit organizations, and government. Students learn how to analyze markets and consumers, develop effective marketing strategies, and implement integrated marketing communication campaigns. The curriculum emphasizes both quantitative and qualitative approaches to marketing, equipping students with the analytical skills needed to make data-driven decisions and the creative skills to develop innovative marketing solutions. The program also offers opportunities for students to gain practical experience through internships, case studies, and real-world projects, fostering a hands-on learning environment.
Accredidation: AACSB-accredited (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business)

This can be demonstrated via TOEFL (minimum score of 85 on the iBT), IELTS (minimum overall band score of 6.5), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 115), or PTE (Pearson Test of English) (minimum score of 56).
Description: A marketing minor allows students majoring in another field to augment their primary area of study with a focus on understanding customers and markets and developing products, services and communications to meet market needs. Students explore the creation of value through customer relationships, pricing strategies, digital marketing, professional selling and market research. The minor introduces students to the core concepts and principles of marketing, and offers elective courses that allow students to further develop their understanding of marketing to help them advance their career goals.

Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit the following: Completed Common Application, including the personal essay and Quinnipiac-specific questions; Official high school transcript(s); One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor.
Description: Mathematics is a challenging and rewarding field of study that provides a foundation for a wide range of careers and graduate programs. The BA program in Mathematics offers students the flexibility to explore the breadth of mathematical disciplines, including pure mathematics, applied mathematics, statistics, and computer science. Students in the program develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills that are highly valued in today’s data-driven world. The curriculum provides a strong theoretical background while also emphasizing the practical applications of mathematics. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in fields such as data science, finance, actuarial science, education, and various technology sectors, as well as for further study in mathematics or related fields.

Requirements: To declare a minor in mathematics, a student should file a Declaration of Minor form in the CAS dean’s office.
Description: The minor in mathematics provides a strong foundation in a field that is critical in many areas of endeavor, ranging from actuarial and data science to engineering and mathematical finance, from economics and education to medicine and business. Students with a strong aptitude for mathematics or those who plan to pursue graduate work in fields requiring a strong background in quantitative reasoning should consider a minor in mathematics. Students minoring in mathematics develop logical and analytical skills and gain a deeper understanding of mathematical principles through coursework in areas such as calculus, discrete mathematics, linear algebra, and statistics.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the following for proof of English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or Pearson PTE. A minimum score of 85 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS, a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test, or a minimum score of 58 on the Pearson PTE.
Requirements: A completed Common Application, including the essay and a nonrefundable $65 application fee; An official high school transcript; One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor.
Description:
The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering program provides students with a broad and rigorous education across a wide range of engineering topics, while cultivating creativity, critical thinking, problem-solving skills and a sense of professionalism and ethics. Graduates are well-prepared to enter the profession and contribute immediately to engineering design, analysis, and development in a diverse set of fields including manufacturing, aerospace, biomedical, energy, transportation and materials. The program also serves as excellent preparation for graduate study in a variety of fields including engineering, business, law and medicine.
Students completing the program will be able to:
*   Identify, formulate, and solve complex engineering problems by applying principles of engineering, science, and mathematics.
*   Apply engineering design to produce solutions that meet specified needs with consideration of public health, safety, and welfare, as well as global, cultural, social, environmental, and economic factors.
*   Communicate effectively with a range of audiences.
*   Recognize ethical and professional responsibilities in engineering situations and make informed judgments, which must consider the impact of engineering solutions in global, economic, environmental, and societal contexts.
*   Function effectively on a team whose members together provide leadership, create a collaborative and inclusive environment, establish goals, plan tasks, and meet objectives.
*   Develop and conduct appropriate experimentation, analyze and interpret data, and use engineering judgment to draw conclusions.
*   Acquire and apply new knowledge as needed, using appropriate learning strategies.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org.
ScholarshipAmount: Scholarships range from $18,000 to $28,000 per year

Description: Through our minor in military science, you can gain an understanding of Army leadership, national security, military history and ethics. Offered in collaboration with the Army Reserve Officers Training Corps (ROTC) at the University of New Haven, this 20-credit program will prepare you to serve as a commissioned officer in the US Army, US Army Reserve or Army National Guard.
ScholarshipType: Army ROTC scholarships, Post-9/11 GI Bill, Yellow Ribbon Program

Description: The minor in music provides a foundation in music theory, history, and performance for students who want to continue their study of music without pursuing it as a primary course of study. The minor requires completion of 18 credits in music courses.

The requirement can be waived for students from certain English-speaking countries, who have attended a US high school/college for 3+ years, or who meet minimum SAT/ACT English scores.

For the Bachelor of Science in Nursing program, applicants are strongly encouraged to submit SAT or ACT scores. Successful candidates typically have a high school GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) program at Quinnipiac University prepares graduates for entry-level professional nursing practice in a variety of healthcare settings. The program is designed to provide students with the knowledge, skills, and values essential for providing safe, high-quality, patient-centered care. Graduates are prepared to function as members of interprofessional healthcare teams, assume leadership roles, and engage in lifelong learning to promote health and improve healthcare outcomes for diverse populations. The curriculum integrates concepts from the arts, sciences, and humanities with nursing theory and practice. Students develop critical thinking, clinical judgment, communication, and technical skills through a combination of classroom instruction, laboratory simulations, and supervised clinical experiences in various healthcare settings. The program emphasizes evidence-based practice, patient safety, quality improvement, informatics, and healthcare policy. Upon successful completion of the program, graduates are eligible to take the National Council Licensure Examination for Registered Nurses (NCLEX-RN) and pursue licensure as a registered nurse.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing at Quinnipiac University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE), 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy degree is the ideal choice for those students who want to develop essential abilities for success in any endeavor, whether that means going directly into the workforce, going on to law school or graduate study, or pursuing a career in philosophy, teaching, or ministry. As a philosophy major, you’ll develop skills in critical thinking, logical reasoning, and effective written and oral communication. You’ll become adept at tackling the world’s most challenging problems by drawing from a rich tradition of philosophical concepts and arguments, and by learning how to apply ethical principles to issues in contemporary life. You will learn to articulate and defend your ideas, to engage in constructive disagreement, and to work collaboratively. You will also become a more articulate and persuasive advocate for yourself and for those around you. The BA in Philosophy provides an excellent preparation for any path you choose.

The minor in philosophy provides students with training in the critical and argumentative skills central to philosophy. Students completing the minor will have an appreciation for the historical development of philosophy as well as contemporary issues in philosophy, broadly construed. ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Physical Therapy (3+3)
EnglishScore: If English is not your first language, you are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. We accept the following from all international applicants: TOEFL iBT: minimum score of 85, IELTS: minimum score of 6.5, PTE: minimum score of 56, Duolingo English Test (DET): minimum score of 115, ELS Language Center: Successful completion of level 112 with a grade of B or better.
Requirements: To be considered for the entry-level dual-degree doctor of physical therapy program, applicants should submit the Common Application, an official high school transcript, a letter of recommendation from a school counselor, a letter of recommendation from a teacher in a core academic course, and a personal essay. SAT/ACT scores are optional.
Description: The Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT) program at Quinnipiac University is a full-time, entry-level DPT program for students seeking a professional degree that prepares them for careers as physical therapists. It offers a variety of academic paths toward a DPT degree, including the accelerated Bachelor of Science in Health Science Studies (BSHSS) or Bachelor of Science in Physical Therapy (BSPT)/DPT (3+3) pathway and the post-baccalaureate DPT (4+3) pathway. This comprehensive program provides students with a strong foundation in human anatomy, physiology, biomechanics, neuroanatomy, pharmacology, and exercise science. Students gain hands-on experience through clinical rotations in diverse settings, preparing them to provide evidence-based, patient-centered care. The program emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and professional development, ensuring graduates are well-equipped to meet the evolving demands of the physical therapy profession. Upon graduation, students are eligible to sit for the National Physical Therapy Examination (NPTE) to become licensed physical therapists. Our graduates are highly sought after by employers and are prepared to excel in various clinical settings.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Physical Therapy Program at Quinnipiac University is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation in Physical Therapy Education (CAPTE), 3030 Potomac Ave., Suite 100, Alexandria, Virginia 22305-3085; telephone: 703-706-3245; email: accreditation@apta.org; website: http://www.capteonline.org. If needing to contact the program/institution directly, please call 203-582-8240 or email pt@qu.edu.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Physician Assistant (3+2)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in English. Quinnipiac University accepts the following: a minimum score of 85 on the TOEFL iBT; a minimum overall score of 6.5 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 56 on the PTE Academic test; or a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test (DET). Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit the following: The completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application; Official high school transcript(s); At least one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor; A personal essay (included in the application); A list of all courses you are taking in your senior year.
Description: The Master of Health Science (MHS) in Physician Assistant program is designed for qualified candidates who hold a bachelor’s degree prior to matriculation. The program prepares students for a demanding and rewarding career as a Physician Assistant in primary care and specialty medical practices. Upon successful completion of the academic and clinical phases of the program, graduates are eligible to take the national certifying examination (PANCE) administered by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants (NCCPA). After passing the PANCE, the graduate is eligible to apply for licensure in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, cultural competency, health literacy, and evidence-based medicine, while fostering professionalism and ethical values. The didactic and clinical phases promote interdisciplinary collaboration and a comprehensive understanding of patient care, preparing Physician Assistants to thrive in diverse healthcare settings. The program is committed to preparing graduates to be compassionate, knowledgeable and skilled healthcare providers to meet the needs of diverse patient populations. This commitment to patient care is exemplified through rigorous coursework, hands-on clinical experiences and a dedication to lifelong learning. The Physician Assistant program aims to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to contribute to the healthcare team, improve patient outcomes and adapt to the evolving landscape of healthcare. With a focus on comprehensive training, ethical practice, and a patient-centered approach, the Quinnipiac University Physician Assistant program is dedicated to shaping the next generation of Physician Assistants who will make a lasting impact on healthcare and the communities they serve.
Accredidation: The Quinnipiac University Physician Assistant Program is accredited by the Accreditation Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant, Inc. (ARC-PA). The program maintains an active accreditation status.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, English proficiency must be demonstrated. This requirement can be met by submitting official results from one of several tests, including TOEFL iBT with a minimum score of 85, IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 56, or the Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105. Other ways to demonstrate proficiency are also available.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you will need to submit the following: A completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, Your official high school transcript, A personal essay, One letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Political Science is for students interested in understanding government, elections, and public policy, as well as the behavior of political actors within the United States and across the globe. Our program provides students with the critical thinking, communication, analytical and research skills necessary for success as they navigate complex political, social and economic issues. Our dynamic curriculum delves into all facets of political inquiry. From political theory to international relations, you’ll explore the underlying principles and practical applications of political systems. Gain the knowledge and skills needed for a career in law, government, public service, journalism and more.

Requirements:
A minimum of 18 credits is required for the minor. Students must complete the following:
- Three 100- or 200-level political science courses
- Three 300- or 400-level political science courses
- A minimum grade of C is required in all courses for the minor.
- A maximum of 6 credits may be transferred into the minor.
Description: The minor in political science offers students an opportunity to learn about governments, public policies, political processes and political behavior. It is designed to provide students with a deeper understanding of political issues through the study of American government, political theory, international relations and comparative government. Students who minor in political science learn to critically analyze political behavior, institutions and public policy. They will improve their written and oral communication skills and develop an understanding of the relationship between policy and democratic processes. The minor provides a strong academic complement to majors across the university, including those in the natural sciences, business, communication and health sciences.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Professional Studies
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: To apply to the bachelor’s in professional studies, you will need to: Submit an application. We require a $65 nonrefundable application fee, but will waive it if you attend one of our information sessions. Submit all official college/university transcripts. Quinnipiac University requires transcripts from all colleges/universities attended to be sent directly from each institution to the Office of Admissions. We recommend that you have a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 2.5. Submit a resume. Submit a personal statement. The personal statement is an essay that helps our faculty learn more about you as a person and as a student. Describe your background and the strengths you will bring to the program and to your future career.
Description: Quinipiac's Bachelor of Arts in Professional Studies program is an online degree completion program that combines classroom, prior learning, and real-world experience, allowing adult learners to complete a bachelor's degree. Students in the Professional Studies Program are able to earn academic credit for knowledge and skills acquired through life experience, prior work, training, military service, and volunteer experience. The program provides adult learners with the opportunity to earn a bachelor's degree and enhance their professional skills with a flexible course schedule that allows students to continue working while they learn.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by submitting scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the online bachelor's degree in professional studies, applicants are required to submit the following: Online application; Official transcripts from all previously attended institutions; An essay or personal statement describing your personal and professional goals and how the online Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies will help you achieve them; A current resume; A cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher from previous college-level coursework.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Public Relations
EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency by providing the results of an English proficiency test. Accepted tests include: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT (recommended minimum score is 85), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) (recommended minimum score is 6.5), Pearson Test of English (PTE) (recommended minimum score is 56), Duolingo English Test (recommended minimum score is 115), ELS English Language Centers (completion of Level 112). The requirement may be waived for students who have completed at least 2 years of study at a high school where English is the language of instruction.
Requirements:
To apply as a first-year student, you will need to submit the following:
- Completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application and nonrefundable $65 application fee
- Official high school transcript(s)
- One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor
- Personal Essay
- A list of your senior year courses
- Standardized Test Scores (optional)
Description:
Public relations is the strategic communication process that builds mutually beneficial relationships between organizations and their publics. Our hands-on Public Relations program focuses on teaching you the skills necessary to become a highly effective and successful public relations practitioner, able to think strategically, solve problems, create compelling content, and tell a brand’s story across various media channels. As a PR major, you’ll be prepared to work as a public relations specialist, media relations specialist, social media manager, content creator, brand manager, event planner and more.
The bachelor’s degree in public relations combines practical, hands-on learning experiences with theoretical knowledge. You’ll develop a strong understanding of ethics, media relations, digital media, social media, content creation, client relations, analytics and the strategic processes of public relations. Through engaging coursework, internships, and student-run agencies, you'll gain valuable real-world experience and build a portfolio of work to showcase your talents.

The Religious Studies minor helps students understand religion as an academic discipline. Students will explore the history, texts, beliefs, practices and social and political organizations of religious traditions from diverse global perspectives. These traditions, ancient and modern, include Judaism, Christianity, Islam, Hinduism, Buddhism, Indigenous traditions and newer religious movements. This interdisciplinary minor helps students understand the role of religion in human society by examining its impact on art, literature, philosophy, ethics, politics and science. The minor is offered by the College of Arts and Sciences.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. Quinnipiac accepts TOEFL, IELTS, PTE and Duolingo English Test examination results. The minimum required score for admission is 85 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 56 on the PTE, or 115 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: The minor in social media is available to all undergraduate students except those in the journalism, public relations, advertising and integrated communications, and media studies majors. A grade of C or better is required in all courses for the minor. A minimum GPA of 2.00 is required for the minor.
Description: The social media minor provides students with the critical skills and knowledge required to develop and implement effective social media strategies for various organizations, ranging from corporations to government agencies to nonprofits. Students learn to create engaging content, analyze social media data, manage online communities, understand the ethical and legal implications of social media, and develop comprehensive social media campaigns. The minor covers a wide range of social media platforms, tools and techniques, preparing students to excel in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. Whether students are pursuing careers in marketing, public relations, journalism, communications, business or other fields, the social media minor offers valuable expertise to help them succeed in today’s interconnected world.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English language proficiency. Quinnipiac University accepts the following to prove proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 85 on the iBT, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum overall score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 110, Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) with a minimum score of 56, or completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
All first-year applicants must submit the following:

- A completed Common Application, including the essay (personal statement) and the nonrefundable $65 application fee
- An official high school transcript showing all courses and grades
- One letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor

Quinnipiac is a test-optional university. This means you have the choice of whether to submit your SAT or ACT scores as part of your application for admission.
Description:
Upon completion of the Bachelor of Arts degree in Sociology, students will be able to:
* Identify and describe major sociological theories and concepts.
* Analyze social issues and problems from a sociological perspective.
* Critically evaluate empirical evidence and research methods in sociology.
* Communicate sociological ideas effectively in written and oral formats.
* Apply sociological knowledge and skills to address real-world problems and promote social change.

Requirements:
A minimum of 18 credits is required for the minor.

At least half the courses for the minor must be completed at Quinnipiac.

A grade of C or better is required in all courses for the minor.
Description: Sociology is the scientific study of human society and social interaction. Sociologists study the social rules and processes that connect and separate people, not only as individuals, but as members of associations, groups and institutions. The sociology minor provides students with the opportunity to pursue the study of society and culture. The minor is appropriate for students seeking to expand their liberal arts education, especially those majoring in the health sciences, education, criminal justice, business, communications and liberal arts.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering
EnglishScore: All international students for whom English is not their native language are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. A minimum score of 85 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 56 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic, or 110 on the Duolingo English Test (DET) is required. Successful completion of Level 112 in the ELS Language Centers' English for Academic Purposes program is also accepted.
Requirements: To apply for first-year admission, applicants must submit a completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, official high school transcript, one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor, and an essay/personal statement. In addition, applicants to the School of Engineering must have completed four years of mathematics, including pre-calculus and/or calculus, and at least one year of a laboratory science (chemistry and/or physics are preferred).
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering program prepares students to apply computer science theory and engineering principles to the development of software solutions across various industries. Students gain a deep understanding of the software development life cycle, including requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance. The curriculum emphasizes object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, operating systems, networking, and databases, with a strong focus on practical application through project-based learning. Graduates are equipped with the technical skills and problem-solving abilities necessary for careers in software development, quality assurance, system analysis, and other related fields.

The Spanish minor allows students to develop an intermediate level of proficiency in Spanish and a deeper understanding of Spanish-speaking cultures. Students in all disciplines can benefit from the acquisition of skills in a language that is vital to the economy and culture of the United States. Many career paths in the United States and abroad require the ability to communicate in Spanish, and students who have earned a Spanish minor find their career opportunities greatly enhanced. The Spanish minor consists of 18 credits above SP 102.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Sports Communications
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done in a variety of ways, but is most commonly satisfied by submitting the official results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) or the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: A complete application includes the Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, official high school transcript(s), one letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor, and a personal essay.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Sports Communications degree program at Quinnipiac University prepares students for a dynamic career in the evolving sports media landscape. Quinnipiac offers a unique program that integrates communication, media arts, and business principles directly related to the sports industry. Students will engage in hands-on learning, develop essential skills in broadcasting, journalism, digital media, and public relations, and gain a comprehensive understanding of sports management and marketing. Our curriculum emphasizes practical experience through internships, campus media organizations, and real-world projects, ensuring graduates are well-equipped to excel in various roles such as sports journalists, broadcasters, social media managers, public relations specialists, and marketing professionals within the collegiate, professional, and corporate sports sectors. With a strong focus on ethical communication and innovative storytelling, the program fosters critical thinking and professional development, preparing students to be leaders and innovators in the sports communications field.

The Applied Statistics and Data Science minor offers students from a wide range of majors the opportunity to cultivate their skills in statistical analysis, programming, and data management. Data science is a rapidly growing field with an increasing demand for skilled professionals who can interpret and analyze large datasets. Students will develop a strong foundation in statistical concepts and methodologies, including descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, regression analysis, and machine learning techniques. Students will also learn to use statistical software (e.g., R, Python) and develop skills in data visualization, data manipulation, and database management. Through hands-on projects and real-world case studies, students will apply their knowledge to solve complex problems and make data-driven decisions. The minor will prepare students for careers in diverse industries such as finance, healthcare, marketing, and technology, as well as for further graduate studies in data science or related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Sustainability and Environmental Policy
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to demonstrate English language proficiency by submitting scores from the TOEFL iBT (85 or higher), IELTS (6.5 or higher), Duolingo English Test (DET) (110 or higher), Pearson PTE Academic (56 or higher), or through completion of ELS Level 112 with a grade of B (2.7/4.0) or higher. Exemptions may apply for citizens of countries where English is the official language or for those who have attended school in the U.S. for at least 3 years.
Requirements: First-year applicants must submit a completed Common Application or Quinnipiac Application, an official high school transcript, and one letter of recommendation from a teacher or school counselor. A personal essay is also required.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Sustainability and Environmental Policy focuses on interdisciplinary study in social, political, economic and scientific issues related to sustainability. Graduates will be prepared to address the challenges of sustainable development through policy-making, strategic planning and public engagement. This program promotes critical thinking about environmental issues, as well as the design and implementation of solutions for a sustainable future. The curriculum combines fundamental scientific principles, social science perspectives and policy analysis to develop a comprehensive understanding of sustainability challenges and solutions. Students develop a comprehensive understanding of current and historic environmental problems, their root causes and potential solutions. The curriculum includes a core of sustainability and environmental policy courses, along with a selection of electives from various disciplines, including natural sciences, social sciences, humanities and business, allowing students to tailor their studies to their specific interests within the broad field of sustainability. Experiential learning opportunities, such as internships, research projects and community engagement initiatives, provide hands-on experience and prepare students for careers in government agencies, non-profit organizations, businesses and international bodies dedicated to sustainability.

The Minor in Supply Chain Management will introduce students to the key concepts and techniques necessary to understand the complex interrelationships of the integrated logistics and supply chain management functions. The minor will expose students to all the major components of supply chain management, including logistics and distribution, procurement, inventory management, production and operations management, and technology in the supply chain.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or the Duolingo English Test. We require a minimum TOEFL score of 85 (iBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum PTE score of 56 or a minimum Duolingo score of 115. The English proficiency testing requirement may be waived for students who have attended a U.S. high school or a high school outside the U.S. where the primary language of instruction is English for three or more years, and who have a grade of B or better in all English classes.
Description: A Minor in Visual Arts offers students the opportunity to learn about the history and theory of art and develop fundamental skills in art-making in different media. This Minor in Visual Arts provides students with a broad understanding of the artistic process—from creating the art piece to understanding the cultural and historical contexts of the art. Through hands-on studio work and art history courses, students learn how to analyze visual works of art and how to utilize different artistic methods and materials to create their own works. The minor prepares students with strong research, critical thinking and analysis skills which are highly valued in any profession. Many Visual Arts minor graduates pursue careers in fields that include graphic design, photography, museum curatorship, arts administration, art therapy, fine art, illustration, and publishing, among others. Students who minor in Visual Arts are also well-prepared for graduate study in art history, fine art, graphic design, art therapy and more.

ProgramName: Minor in Women's and Gender Studies
Description: The Women’s and Gender Studies Minor invites students to critically examine gender, race, class, sexuality, age, nation, and ability. Drawing on the humanities, social sciences, and natural sciences, the minor provides students with the critical tools necessary to understand the diverse experiences of women and other marginalized groups, as well as the structures of gender and power in various social, historical, cultural, and political contexts. Students will also be introduced to feminist thought and activism through an intersectional lens and will develop skills in critical thinking, writing, and analysis. Students minoring in Women’s and Gender Studies will be better prepared to understand and address issues related to social justice and equality in their academic, professional, and personal lives.
